intro: Cardiagyris dimorphophylla, commonly known as the two-leafed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. The plant has a thallus that is divided into two distinct lobes, giving it its common name. Its structure includes both a gametophyte and a sporophyte stage in its life cycle. Cardiagyris dimorphophylla is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
